author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: قُدْرَتِكَ لَوْ تُعَذِّبُنا بِعَذابِ الأَوَّلِينَ وَالآخِرِينَ لَتكُونُ عادِلاً فِي أَمْرِكَ وَمَحْمُودًا فِي فِعْلِكَ، وَإِنَّكَ أَنْتَ المُقْتَدِرُ عَلَى ما تَشآءُ لا إِلهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ المُقْتَدِرُ العَزِيزُ المُهَيْمِنُ القَيُّومُ.
translation: We are Thy servants, O my Lord, and in the grasp of Thy power. If Thou chastisest us with the chastisement inflicted upon the former and the latter generations, Thy verdict would be assuredly just and Thine act praiseworthy. Powerful art Thou to do what pleaseth Thee. None other God is there beside Thee, the Almighty, the All-Glorious, the Help in Peril, the Self-Subsisting.
